result.execSummary:
The defendant David P. Hartman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
No Contact with Victim (Schierl Tire), 

Maintain Absolute Sobriety from Alcohol and Controlled Substances unless prescribed and only within the prescribed amounts.
Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office. 

Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, 

AODA and Follow up (at the agent's discretion), 

DNA Sample. 

No objection for transfer to Wood County.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David P. Hartman

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Case Called: 10:30 am
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen in person. Defendant appears in person, pro se. Victim appears in the Courtroom.
VRCW.
Defendant states that he wishes to proceed without counsel. 
Waiver of Counsel colloquy was already completed at the last hearing. 
State is to provide an Offer to the Defendant; Parties are wishing to proceed with Plea Hearing today.
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. 
PLEA: 
Ct. 1 (Theft-Business Setting <=$2500)>> GUILTY.
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
Ct. 1 (Theft-Business Setting <=$2500)>> Sentence W/H- 1 Year Probation. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, AODA and Follow up (at the agent's discretion), No Contact with Victim (Schierl Tire), Restitution in the amount of $774.95 (plus 10% Surcharge) to be paid to Schierl Tire, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination, Maintain Absolute Sobriety from Alcohol and Controlled Substances unless prescribed and only within the prescribed amounts, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. No objection for transfer to Wood County.

Adjourned: 10:43 am
Final pre-trial on October 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Clerk: Amanda. 
Case Called at 2:46 pm.
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo.  Defendant appears, pro se. 
VRCW. 

State is requesting an adjournment of today's matter due to Marsy's Law. 
Defendant is not wishing to obtain counsel. 
Court advises defendant right of counsel. 
State will send an offer to defendant. Defendant to bring filled out Plea Questionnaire/Waiver back at next hearing.

NEXT DATE:

Final pre-trial on August 31, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Deft appears

Final pre-trial on August 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Jury Trial on September 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

No contact with victim(s): Sheirl Tire.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.

Clerk: Amanda.
Case called at 2:51 pm.
State appears by ADA Cody Marschall. Defendant appears prose. 
Date and Time set for IA; VRCW. 

Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 

PLEA:  NOT GUILTY.

COURT ORDERS: $250 sig bond - CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s):  Sheirl Tire. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
- Prints and photograph.
